com.cmart.PageControllers

Class PageController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cmart.PageControllers.PageController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnswerQuestionController, AskQuestionController, BidHistoryController, BrowseCategoryController, BrowseVideoItemController, BrowseVideosController, BuyItemController, ChangePrefetchValueController, CommentItemController, ConfirmBidController, ConfirmBuyController, ConfirmCommentController, ConfirmFriendRequestController, ConfirmMessageController, ConfirmSellItemController, DBSpeedTestController, ExampleBlankController, FaultController, GetBulkDataController, GetNewsFeedController, GetUsersController, GetWallPostController, HomeController, LoginController, LogoutController, MoveOldItemsController, MyAccountController, ReadFriendRequestController, ReadMessageController, RegisterUserController, SearchController, SellItemController, SellItemImageBk, SellItemImagesController, SendFriendRequestController, SendMessageController, StatisticsController, TestDBController, UpdateUserDetailsController, UploadedRedirectController, UploadVideoController, ViewItemController, ViewUserController

    public abstract class PageController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the base class for all of the page controller. It defines the abstract class that all page controller must have to process the HTML4 and HTML5 data. It also keep track of the pages statistica
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andy (andrewtu@cmu.edu)

      • getTotalTime

        public long getTotalTime()
        Returns the total time taken to finish the page (excluding the footer since we need to the time taken so we can print it)
        Returns:
        long the total time taken to parse the page

      • getSuppressOutput

        public boolean getSuppressOutput()
        Returns whether the page should suppress the text output Andy: I was using this to reduce network traffic
        Returns:
        boolean if we should not output text to the user

      • getProcessingLoop

        public int getProcessingLoop()
        Returns how many times the page should process the page data Andy: I was using this to stress test the app tier without stressing the DB. Can also be used to pretend that the app is more complex than it really is
        Returns:
        int the number of times to loop the processing of the page's parameters

      • getErrors

        public java.util.ArrayList<Error> getErrors()
        Returns any errors that happened while processing the page. Errors will be different severity on different pages. Browsing doesn't care if you're not logged in
        Returns:
        ArrayList the errors that are present on the page
